title: Trump and his prosecutors: From insults to political maneuvers
summary: Three of the court cases involving the former president are being led by Black Democratic prosecutors, whom he has accused of racism. Meanwhile, he is gaining time: The first trial, scheduled for March 25, has been postponed on Friday, March 15, by the judge presiding over this case.

title: Russia election: Nine arrested for vandalizing ballot boxes as voting starts
summary: On the first of three days of voting in the presidential election, at least nine people were arrested for vandalizing polling stations by pouring dye into ballot boxes and arson attacks.

title: Putin voters: 'He's the only one who can bring peace'
summary: The war in Ukraine is at the heart of preoccupations for the people of Korolyov, a town in the Moscow region. But voters polled on the first day of the presidential election credited it to the Kremlin leader, who is seeking a fifth term.

title: Israel denies visas to aid workers in Gaza
summary: Since the October 7 Hamas attacks, employees of UN agencies and numerous international NGOs based in Jerusalem have had difficulty renewing their residence permits, hampering the coordination of relief supplies to the Palestinian enclave.

title: Germany, France and Poland vow to procure more weapons for Ukraine
summary: The leaders of the three countries gave no detail and took no questions as they spoke after a meeting in Berlin.

title: Taylor Swift's Singapore concerts are the envy of Southeast Asia
summary: The city-state, which has spent millions of dollars to secure the star's exclusive rights in the region, is facing fierce criticism from its neighbors, who accuse it of unfair competition.

title: 2024 US presidential election: Former VP Mike Pence 'will not be endorsing Donald Trump'
summary: US media called the announcement a "bombshell" and "startling," although in reality, deep divisions have driven the two men apart since leaving office.

title: Boeing 737 found to have missing panel after flight from California to Oregon
summary: United said the plane was carrying 139 passengers and six crew. "We'll conduct a thorough examination of the plane and perform all the needed repairs before it returns to service," the airline said, adding it will also investigate the cause of the incident.

title: Paris 2024: Who could be better than Aya Nakamura to represent France at the Olympics?
summary: The singer, whose participation in the opening ceremony of the Games has been raised as a possibility, has suffered attacks from the far right as a consequence.

title: 34 migrants rescued off Tunisia coast, two dead after boat sinks
summary: With improving weather in the last weeks, the flow of African migrants, including Tunisians, in boats heading for Italy has increased.

title: Investigation into 2021 Channel deaths reveals French rescuers were ignoring emergency frequency
summary: Le Monde has learned that French military rescuers aboard Le Flamant were not monitoring the emergency channel on the night in November 2021 when at least 27 drowned in the English Channel, even though it is 'mandatory.'

title: Irish PM's St Patrick's Day talks with Biden overshadowed by Gaza
summary: Speaking after their annual St Patrick's Day talks, Leo Varadkar pulled no punches about his disagreement with his American counterpart, saying 'none of us like to see American weapons being used in the way they are.'

title: Macron repeats 'nothing excluded' on Ukraine, rebuts accusations of electoral opportunism
summary: In a prime-time televised discussion, the French president responded to criticism and concerns following his controversial statements on the possibility of sending allied troops to Ukraine in support of Kyiv.

title: Champions League quarter-final draw: Holders Manchester City face Real Madrid, PSG meets Barcelona again
summary: Arsenal will play Bayern Munich and Atletico Madrid will face Borussia Dortmund in the other two ties.

title: War in Ukraine: Germany's ruling coalition splits over sending Taurus missiles to Kyiv
summary: An opposition motion calling for the missiles to be delivered was largely rejected by the coalition government, but the debate laid bare the differences among the Social Democrats, Greens and Liberals on the subject.

title: The Netherlands pick France's Naval Group for submarines deal
summary: Worth billions of euros to the French firm, the four-submarine deal still has to be approved by Dutch Parliament.

title: Biden praises US Senate leader demanding elections in Israel
summary: The call by Democratic Senate majority chief Chuck Schumer, the highest-ranking elected Jewish American in history, was the most strident rebuke of Israel yet by a senior US official since Hamas's October 7 attacks.

title: In Argentina, Javier Milei is cutting off food aid to local social service organizations
summary: The government, aiming to maintain its 'zero deficit' goal despite the sharp rise in inflation, is targeting NGOs, which have fewer and fewer food resources available to distribute to the most vulnerable.

title: Haiti crisis: Kenya's hesitations in leading the UN peacekeeping forces
summary: The resignation of Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry has dampened Nairobi's enthusiasm as it prepares to deploy a thousand police officers to the Caribbean nation.

title: 'Russia's presidential election is about Putin convincing himself and others that he has mastered all the workings of the system'
summary: Even though the Russian presidential election, held from March 15 to 17 – and its foregone conclusion – struggle to captivate the population, Vladimir Putin needs a plebiscite to legitimize his regime, explains Tatiana Kastouéva-Jean, a Russia specialist, in an opinion piece for Le Monde.

title: Le Monde and Open AI sign partnership agreement on artificial intelligence
summary: This multi-year agreement, the first between a French media organization and a major AI player, will enable OpenAI to draw on our newspaper's corpus to establish and enhance the reliability of the answers of its ChatGPT tool, in return for a significant source of additional revenue.

title: Lisa, Louka, Mathéïs: Three heartbreaking stories infanticide and missed red flags
summary: Every five days in France, a child is killed within their family. Almost always, investigations show that these crimes are preceded by warnings that society either doesn't want to hear or doesn't know how to heed. It's a collective, systemic failure.

title: The 'passport bro,' neocolonialist looking for his 'trad wife'
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, she focuses on the 'passport bro,' a North American or European man who uses his ID as a key to satisfy his sexual tourism tastes.

title: In Sao Paulo, the rebirth of 'Brazilian Hollywood'
summary: From the 1960s to the 1980s, the Boca do Lixo district was a nerve center for the seventh art, producing over 1,000 counterculture films. Today, the Soberano bar – the headquarters of this chaotic and extravagant cinema – has reopened its doors.

title: Sinn Féin on the brink of power in both the North and Republic of Ireland
summary: Northern Ireland's institutions are up and running again after two years of being blocked by the unionists. For the first time, the leadership of the executive has fallen to the former political wing of the Irish Republican Army.

title: Exceptional antique vase on display in Paris region
summary: Discovered in 2020 during preventive excavations, the glass object has been restored to its former glory. The National Museum of Archaeology has devoted an exhibition to it.

title: 'Able to create our own masculinity': Drag kings emerge from queens' shadows
summary: Less widely publicized, drag kings have been present in France since the late 1990s. Performers from the Kings Factory spoke with Le Monde as the group celebrated its fifth anniversary.
